definition[0]: to become separated from the main part of something
example[0]: One of the wires in the plug had come away.
example[1]: I turned some of the pages and they came away in my hand.
definition[1]: to leave a place with a particular feeling or idea
example[2]: We came away thinking that we had done quite well.
example[3]: I came away with the impression that the school was very well run.
